article_title: With Obamacare Back On Trial, This Graphic Shows It May Be Hurting Americans More Than It Is Helping
article_text:


Obamacare is once again in the news as the Supreme Court has began to hear oral arguments in the case of King v. Burwell.

For those unfamiliar with the case, the question being debated is whether tax subsidies can be extended to people who bought insurance on a federal exchange, rather than one set up by the individual states.

Obamacare supporters argue that a ruling for the plaintiff would be at the expense of millions of newly-insured Americans. They suggest that the overall goal of expanding coverage would be completely undermined, and cost millions of people their coverage, drive up the cost of health insurance premiums and insurers will suffer major financial losses.

While there is much at stake for the future of Obamacare, it’s effects so far are also worth examining. Daily Signal has created an infographic detailing Obamacare’s cost and impact:

While the case that may determine if Obamacare continues to exist is being debated, most of America has already decided.

A Gallup poll shows that currently only 37% of Americans say they approve of the law, while 56% disapprove — the highest disapproval rate since the law was first set in motion.

Another Gallup poll from this past August shows how people feel about Obamacare is widely based from state-to-state:

While the Obama administration argues to push forward with Obamacare, despite popular opinion and impact, only time, and the Supreme Court, will tell if it will be around much longer.
